document_data.name: Runner-Vine
document_data.Description: Runner-vine were easily cultivated. Some households in Suzail planted theses edible beans on their back yard annually. When grown, runner-vines formed thick hanging curtains, climbing up nearby surfaces.
document_data.History: As of the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], [[Bhaerusk Montalar]], the proprietor of [[Montalar's Happy House]] in Suzail, planted runner-vines at his restaurant's back entrance.
